medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient initially presented with right flank and abdominal pain consistent with prior kidney stones 2 days prior to admission. The pain then became epigastric, associated with one episode of emesis and poor oral intake. The patient reports the last bowel movement was 4 days ago. No fevers were noted. Pain was well controlled with dilaudid in the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Calcium oxalate kidney stones, s/p lithotripsy x2; Depression; GERD.
